item.title: Resistance to natural and synthetic gene drive systems
An X-linked meiotic drive allele has strong, recessive fitness costs in female Drosophila pseudoobscura
item.description: We measured the effects of a natural gene drive, Sex Ratio (SR), on fitness in Drosophila pseudoobscura. We find that SD is very costly, especially when homozygous, and that it also has transgenerational effects on offspring fitness and sex ratio. Using a model, we show that these effects may explain the frequency and clinal patterns of SR in nature.

item.title: Fitness consequences of the selfish supergene Segregation Distorter
item.description: We measured the effects of a natural gene drive, Segregation Distorter (SD), on fitness in Drosophila melanogaster. We find that SD is very costly, especially when homozygous, and that it also has transgenerational effects on offspring fitness and sex ratio. Using a model, we show that these effects may explain the puzzling rarity of SD in nature.

item.title: Evolutionary simulations of Z-linked suppression gene drives
item.description: This paper presents eco-evo simulations investigating the feasibility of a newly-proposed type of gene drive, the W-shredder. W-shredders might someday be used to control populations of pests and pathogens that have ZW sex determination, such as Lepidopteran pests, parasitic trematodes, and cane toads.
